about_the_game:
The Lower Tunguska is the largest tributary of the Yenisei River, one of the most famous and majestic rivers of Siberia. Its wild and rugged beauty and the abundance of fish make Lower Tunguska incredibly attractive to fishing enthusiasts. In spite of its remote location, away from any civilization, the fishing camp has a well-developed infrastructure. There is a cafe, several shops and a boat station. In addition to ordinary shops, a branded shop operates on the territory of the camp, where you can buy handmade bait and lures.

The Lower Tunguska River is the first body of water in the game Russian Fishing 4, located outside the European part of Russia.Welcome to Siberia, friends!

In this update you will find:
  • 26 new fish species
  • A new class of reels - heavy baitcasters.
  • A new type of surface lures.

Regards,
Russian Fishing 4 Team

name: Russian Fishing 4 - Lower Tunguska River

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7/8/10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel® i5 3Ghz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 760
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 40 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7/8/10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel® i5 3.5Ghz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GTX 1060
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 40 GB available space

short_description: Lower Tunguska is the largest tributary of the Yenisei, one of the most famous and majestic rivers of Siberia. The harsh beauty of the wildlife and the abundance of fish make the Lower Tunguska incredibly attractive for fishing enthusiasts. Your RF4 Team
supported_languages: English, German, Russian, Simplified Chinese, French, Spanish - Spain, Polish, Portuguese - Brazil, Dutch, Korean, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, Turkish
